item.title: Asteroids on collision course? Three asteroids to zoom past Earth in December - News9 LIVE
item.description:
Three Massive Asteroids Zooming Past Earth This December

Publication Date: December 16

Source: Science News

Three near-Earth objects (NEOs) are scheduled to make close passes to Earth today. Although these asteroids won't impact our planet this time, their paths are being monitored for future encounters.

  • Asteroid 2024 VE7 will come within 2.79 million kilometers of Earth.
  • Asteroid 2024 XY5 will approach at approximately 3.5 million kilometers.
  • Asteroid 2024 XE16 is set to fly by at a distance of around 6.8 million kilometers.
"While a direct collision is considered highly improbable, the orbits of these asteroids can shift due to gravitational interactions with other celestial bodies."

Ongoing observations are vital for advancing planetary defense initiatives and understanding asteroid trajectory modeling.

item.title: Want to have sharp mind? Do this activity daily to increase intelligence for 24 hours - The Times of India
item.description:
Want to have sharp mind? Do this activity daily to increase intelligence for 24 hours

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: International Journal of Behavioral Nutrition and Physical Activity

The article discusses how engaging in moderate to vigorous exercise can enhance memory and cognitive function for up to 24 hours, based on new research findings. It explains the mechanisms behind this brain boost and offers practical suggestions for incorporating exercise into daily routines.

Key Points:

  • Exercise enhances brain blood flow, oxygen, and nutrient delivery.
  • Physical activity releases feel-good brain chemicals, improving focus and mood.
  • Exercise improves sleep quality, especially deep sleep, aiding in memory processing.
  • Benefits from exercise can last into the next day, contrary to previous beliefs.
  • Simple activities like walking, dancing, and yoga can be effective.
“Anything that gets your heart rate up—like climbing stairs or a quick jog—can make a big difference for your brain. And the benefits extend well beyond a few hours after exercising.” - Dr. Mikaela Bloomberg

The article emphasizes that regular moderate exercise is key not just for physical health, but for cognitive capabilities as well.

item.title: Parliament Winter Session Live: Nehru jailed Majrooh Sultanpuri, Balraj Sahni, says Sitharaman - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Parliament Winter Session Live: Cong MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra demands restoration of '71 war photo

Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

During the Winter Session of Parliament, Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra raised the issue of restoring a historic photo from the 1971 war, emphasizing the need to acknowledge the sacrifices of Indian soldiers.

  • The final week of the Winter Session features debates on key constitutional issues.
  • The government is likely to defer the constitutional amendment bill for simultaneous elections.
  • Priyanka Gandhi highlighted the bravery of soldiers and the leadership of Indira Gandhi during the 1971 conflict.
“I want to salute the brave soldiers who fought for us in the war of 1971,” said Priyanka Gandhi.

The discussions reflect ongoing tensions regarding historical narratives and national memory within Indian politics.

item.title: Inventurus Knowledge Solutions IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Issue booked 7.19x so far, check IKS IPO GMP, review, more | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Inventurus Knowledge Solutions IPO Day 3 Updates: Subscribed 13.54x

Date: 16 Dec, 2024
Source: HT Digital Streams Limited

The IPO for Inventurus Knowledge Solutions has witnessed significant demand, being subscribed 13.54 times overall. The retail investor segment has seen a strong response, ensuring an impressive bidding process.

  • The overall subscription rate reached 13.54 times.
  • Retail Individual Investors (RIIs) subscription was 9.13 times.
  • Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIBs) segment was subscribed 6.06 times.
  • The IPO price band is set at ₹1,265-1,329 per share.
  • Inventurus has raised ₹1,120 crore from anchor investors.
  • This IPO is an Offer For Sale (OFS) with no new issue of shares.
  • Notable players in the company's backing include Rekha Jhunjhunwala.
"The total addressable market for US enablement technology solutions providers is expected to reach USD 323 bn by CY28."

As the IPO draws to a close today, market experts highlight it as a considerable opportunity for long-term investors looking into the expanding healthcare sector.

item.title: NSA Ajit Doval Likely To Visit China For Special Representative Talks: Sources - News18
item.description:
NSA Ajit Doval Set to Visit China for Key Talks

Date: December 16, 2024

Source: News18

National Security Advisor Ajit Doval is expected to visit China soon for Special Representative talks, according to sources.

  • The visit comes after External Affairs Minister Dr. S Jaishankar discussed India-China relations in Parliament.
  • Jaishankar highlighted improvements in bilateral ties and full disengagement in eastern Ladakh.
  • He remarked on the ongoing diplomatic engagements that have set the stage for better Indo-China ties.
  • India and China have faced military tensions since May 2020 due to confrontations in the Galwan Valley.
“Recent developments that reflect continuous diplomatic engagements have set Indo-China ties in the direction of some improvement,” said Jaishankar.

The upcoming talks are seen as a crucial step in consolidating progress in India-China relationships following prolonged military standoffs.

item.title: Love avocados? They have these surprising side effects - Firstpost
item.description:
The Surprising Side Effects of Eating Too Many Avocados

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Firstpost

This article discusses various side effects that can occur from consuming avocados in excess, despite their many health benefits.

  • Allergic reactions: Individuals with latex allergies may have reactions similar to avocado consumption.
  • Weight gain: Due to high fat content, overeating avocados can lead to weight gain.
  • Gastrointestinal issues: Excessive amounts can cause bloating or diarrhea due to high fiber.
  • High potassium levels: Overconsumption may lead to hyperkalemia, affecting heart health.
  • Medication interference: Can interact with blood thinners due to vitamin K content.
  • Nutrient imbalance: Dominating one's diet with avocados may crowd out other nutrients.
  • Heartburn or acid reflux: Some may experience reflux symptoms post-consumption.
  • Skin issues: Increased skin oiliness or breakouts can occur for some individuals.
  • Environmental concerns: High demand has led to deforestation and unsustainable practices.
“Avocados may interact with medications like blood thinners because of their vitamin K content.”

In conclusion, while avocados are nutrient-rich, moderation is key to avoiding negative side effects.

item.title: Bengaluru techie suicide: Estranged wife Nikita Singhania claims Atul Subhash 'harassed' her - The Times of India
item.description:
Bengaluru Techie Suicide: Estranged Wife Claims Harassment by Husband

Date: Not specified | Source: Times of India

In a tragic case from Bengaluru, Nikita Singhania, the estranged wife of techie Atul Subhash, has refuted claims of harassment against her husband, asserting that she was the one who suffered harassment instead.

  • Nikita claims to have stayed away from Atul for almost three years, disputing allegations made against her.
  • Atul Subhash, aged 34, died by suicide, leaving behind a video and a 24-page death note detailing his struggles with domestic issues.
  • His note mentioned harassment from his in-laws, including monetary demands.
  • Atul requested punishment for his harassers and stated his last rites should not proceed until then.
  • The case has raised discussions around men's rights and mental health.
“I apologize to my parents for not being able to take care of them in their old age.” - Atul Subhash

This incident highlights the complexities of domestic relationships and the critical issues of mental health and harassment that are often overlooked.

item.title: 10 common habits that promote longevity - The Times of India
item.description:
10 Common Habits That Promote Longevity

Date: Dec 16, 2024 Source: TimesOfIndia.com

Incorporating certain habits can help promote long-term health and enhance the quality of life, allowing individuals to live longer and happier lives.

  • Promote long-term health and well-being
  • Learn stress management techniques through yoga and meditation
  • Stay hydrated for essential bodily functions
  • Live with purpose for mental and emotional motivation
  • Practice gratitude daily to enhance mental health
  • Limit intake of sugar and processed foods
  • Grow a garden to improve well-being and encourage physical activity
  • Maintain strong social connections for better mental health
  • Get enough sleep for overall health
  • Focus on consuming nutrient-rich foods
  • Keep learning to support cognitive health
“Most people eat plant-based diets containing vegetables, fruits, legumes, and whole grains which boost digestion, energy and vitality.”

Adopting these habits not only supports a longer life but also ensures better health and happiness throughout.

item.title: Watch: 3 idols recovered from well near Sambhal's Shiv-Hanuman temple - The Times of India
item.description:
Three Idols Recovered from Well Near Sambhal's Shiv-Hanuman Temple

Date: Monday, Source: Times of India

Three idols were retrieved from a well adjacent to the Shiv-Hanuman Temple in Sambhal, which has been closed since 1978 due to riots.

  • The temple was reopened on December 14 after 46 years.
  • The recovered idols include one of Lord Ganesh and another believed to be of Lord Kartikeya.
  • The recovery was made during excavation work related to the well that began due to issues of electricity theft.
  • A prayer ceremony was held at the temple coinciding with the idol recovery.
“These are broken idols that were found during the digging of well. The area has been secured so that excavation can be done smoothly,” said Shrish Chandra, Sambhal additional superintendent of police.

This event highlights the intersection of history, religion, and community issues, marking a significant moment in the restoration of a cultural site long forgotten.

item.title: Congress Reacts After Omar Abdullah Junks Opposition's EVM Charge - NDTV
item.description:
Congress Reacts After Omar Abdullah Junks Opposition's EVM Charge

Publication Date: December 16, 2024   Source: NDTV

The Congress party has criticized ally Omar Abdullah's stance on opposition issues, particularly regarding recent allegations of manipulation of Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs), after Abdullah dismissed these claims.

  • Omar Abdullah's party, the National Conference, contested the Jammu and Kashmir elections alongside the Congress.
  • Congress parliamentarian Manickam Tagore highlighted differing views on EVMs among opposition parties following recent elections.
  • Recent opposition claims regarding EVM discrepancies were led by Sharad Pawar's NCP and Shiv Sena (UBT).
  • Congress's Working Committee has accused the Election Commission of partisan conduct and hinted at targeted manipulation.
  • Abdullah stated that political parties doubting EVMs should refrain from participating in elections.
Mr. Abdullah stated, "When you get a hundred plus members of parliament using the same EVMs, and you celebrate that... you can't... turn around and say... we don't like these EVMs because now the election results aren't going the way we would like them to."

The debate over EVM integrity showcases significant differences within the opposition and raises questions about electoral processes in India.

item.title: Parliament Winter Session Day 17 LIVE Updates: Congress only made Amendments in Constitution to help the dynasty, says FM in RS; Priyanka Gandhi raises concern over human-animal conflict - The Hindu
item.description:
Parliament Winter Session Day 17 LIVE Updates: Congress only made Amendments in Constitution to help the dynasty, says FM in RS; Priyanka Gandhi raises concern over human-animal conflict

Date: December 16, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The Parliament session on December 16, 2024, saw significant discussions on constitutional amendments and challenges faced by citizens due to human-animal conflicts.

  • Congress MP Manickam Tagore raised an adjournment motion regarding the removal of a historical 1971 war photograph from Army HQ.
  • Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman criticized Congress for amending the Constitution to protect political interests rather than strengthen democracy.
  • Priyanka Gandhi highlighted the plight of citizens affected by wild animal attacks, specifically mentioning nearly 90 incidents in Wayanad.
  • Sanjay Raut emphasized the government's actions counter to the Constitution during his speech in the Rajya Sabha.
  • Debates continued around the historical significance of the Constitution and its ongoing relevance in contemporary politics.
“Amendments were not about strengthening democracy but protecting those in power,” Nirmala Sitharaman in Rajya Sabha.

This session reflects ongoing tensions between political parties regarding governance and public safety, emphasizing the need for urgent dialogue on these pressing issues.

item.title: Joe Rogan worried about drone sightings after chilling new theory floats, ‘Genuinely concerned’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Joe Rogan worried about drone sightings after chilling new theory floats, ‘Genuinely concerned’

Date: Dec 16, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Joe Rogan has expressed genuine concern over unverified drone sightings in New Jersey after watching a viral TikTok video suggesting they may be searching for harmful substances.

  • Rogan's comments came after observing a theory by John Ferguson, a CEO of a drone company, who speculated that drones might be detecting gas leaks or radioactive materials.
  • Despite reassurances from government officials that the drones are not a public safety threat, Rogan remains skeptical of these claims.
  • Various theories about the purpose of the drone sightings have emerged, including suggestions of foreign involvement.
  • Former President Donald Trump has also weighed in, urging authorities to disclose more information about the sightings and suggesting a more aggressive approach.
“This is the first video about these drones that has got me genuinely concerned.” – Joe Rogan

Rogan’s reaction highlights the public's interest and concern regarding the safety implications of unidentified drone activity.

item.title: Moment of the Weekend: Amad for Amorim - Manchester derby lit up by Diallo's magical strike - ESPN India
item.description:
Amad Diallo Shines in Manchester Derby with Stunning Goal

Date: Dec 16, 2024, Source: ESPN

Amad Diallo's exceptional performance led Manchester United to a thrilling victory against Manchester City, highlighted by a magical strike that secured the win in the Manchester derby.

  • Diallo displayed his relentless energy and skill throughout the match.
  • He won a penalty that was converted by Bruno Fernandes to equalize the game.
  • In the dying moments, Diallo scored the winning goal with a remarkable finish.
  • His captain, Fernandes, praised Diallo for his vital contributions.
“He showed again today he is always alive... He has been brilliant. When he is like this he is unstoppable.” - Bruno Fernandes

This performance marks a significant moment in Diallo's career as he cements his place in the starting lineup under new coach Ruben Amorim.

item.title: Plea In Supreme Court Against Yati Narsinghanand's 'Dharam Sansad'; Contempt Action Sought Against Uttar... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Legal Action Sought Against Yati Narsinghanand's 'Dharam Sansad' in Supreme Court

Date & Source: Not specified, Livelaw

Introduction: A contempt petition has been filed against the Uttar Pradesh administration and police for not taking action against the 'Dharam Sansad' organized by Yati Narasinghanand, known for making communal statements targeting the Muslim community.

  • The petitioners include former civil servants and activists who argue that the 'Dharam Sansad' includes hate speeches and incites violence against Muslims.
  • The Ghaziabad District Administration and the Uttar Pradesh police have been accused of failing to act as per Supreme Court directions.
  • Advocate Prashant Bhushan mentioned the matter before the Chief Justice of India for urgent listing.
  • Petitioners include Aruna Roy, Ashok Kumar Sharma, Deb Mukarji, Navrekha Sharma, Syeda Hameed, and Vijayan MJ.
  • The 'Dharam Sansad' events in 2021 led to controversy and Yati Narasinghanand's arrest.
The Supreme Court has issued notice to him in a criminal contempt case over his remarks against the judiciary.

Conclusion: The petition seeks urgent action against the 'Dharam Sansad' to prevent further communal tensions and hate speech.

item.title: 2024 Honda Amaze Review : 9 Pros & 8 Cons - Team-BHP
item.description:
2024 Honda Amaze Review: 9 Pros & 8 Cons

Publication Date: 16th December 2024, Source: Omkar Shendge

A big USP of the Amaze is that it comes with a CVT automatic while the other cars in the segment come with an AMT.

This article reviews the 2024 Honda Amaze, highlighting its advantages and disadvantages. The Amaze stands out for its CVT option compared to the AMT used by competitors.

Key Points:

  • Smart styling with clean lines.
  • Practical interior with good cabin space.
  • 1.2-litre petrol engine is rev-happy and delivers adequate performance.
  • Comfortable ride quality with neutral on-road behavior.
  • Offers smooth CVT as the only automatic transmission option in its segment.
  • 416-litre boot is one of the largest in its category.
  • Safety features include ADAS Level 2 tech and 6 airbags.
  • Comes with a 3-year unlimited km warranty, extendable to 5 years.

Cons:

  • Higher starting price compared to competitors.
  • CVT variants come with a significant premium.
  • Tight headroom for rear passengers.
  • Short gearing in the manual transmission.
  • Lacks certain expected features like a 360-degree camera.
  • No factory-fitted CNG option.
  • Quality of interior plastics is subpar.

Read Team-BHP's detailed 2024 Honda Amaze Review here.

item.title: Zakir Hussain: Legendary tabla player dies at 73 - BBC.com
item.description:
Zakir Hussain: Legendary Tabla Player Dies at 73

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: News Agency

Zakir Hussain, one of the world's greatest tabla players, has died at the age of 73 due to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.

  • Hussain was a four-time Grammy award winner and received the Padma Vibhushan.
  • He transformed the tabla into a globally loved solo instrument.
  • Tributes have started pouring in following his death.
  • Nayan Ghosh described him as a pathbreaker and an icon who elevated tabla on the world stage.
“He was a pathbreaker, a game-changer, an icon who put tabla and Indian music on the world map...” - Nayan Ghosh

This legendary musician, born in Mumbai in 1951, has left an indelible mark on classical music.

Samsung is set to unveil its Galaxy S25 series at the Galaxy Unpacked 2025 event on January 22, 2025, in San Jose, California, alongside its first XR headset, Project Moohan.

  • Event date set for January 22, 2025, at 10 AM PT.
  • Expected launches include the Galaxy S25, S25+, and S25 Ultra.
  • Project Moohan, Samsung's XR headset, will be teased.
  • The starting price for the Galaxy S25 is speculated to be $799.
“Samsung Galaxy Unpacked 2025 📅 : January 22nd, 2025 🕙 : 10 a.m. PT 📍 : San Jose, California” — Alvin (@sondesix)

The upcoming Galaxy Unpacked event is highly anticipated, as it represents a continuation of Samsung's trend of new smartphone releases early in the year, offering innovation in both mobile and XR technologies.

item.title: Vishal Mega Mart IPO allotment to be finalised today: Steps to check status on BSE, NSE, KFin Tech - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Vishal Mega Mart IPO Allotment Finalized Today: Steps to Check Status on BSE, NSE, KFin Tech

Date & Source: Dec 16, 2024 IST, CNBC TV18

Supermarket chain Vishal Mega Mart is set to finalize the allotment of its initial public offering (IPO) today. The company's shares are scheduled to debut on the BSE and NSE on December 18.

  • The IPO was open for subscription from December 11 to 13 and received a total subscription of 27.28 times.
  • The price band was set at ₹74-78 per share.
  • Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIBs) subscribed 80.75 times the shares reserved for them.
  • The non-institutional investors' portion was subscribed 14.24 times, while the retail portion was subscribed 2.31 times.
  • Allotted shares will be credited to demat accounts by December 17, and refunds for unsuccessful bids will also be initiated the same day.
  • Vishal Mega Mart raised ₹2,400 crore from anchor investors before the IPO.
  • Established in 2001, Vishal Mega Mart operates 645 stores across 414 cities in India.
“Allotted shares will be credited to the applicants' demat accounts.”

This IPO is a significant step for Vishal Mega Mart as they continue to cater to middle- and lower-middle-income groups across India.
